section.title: Exercise: Getting started with SWT Designer
Installation
section.para:
Install SWT Designer if you have not already done this. See
for a description.

section.title: Building an user interface
section.para:
Right-click on your PlaygroundPart class and select
Open With WindowBuilder Editor
.

note.para: WindowBuilder uses the @PostConstruct method to identify that a class is an Eclipse part. This method needs to specify at least a Composite as parameter.

section.para: Switch to the Design tab in the WindowBuilder editor. This selection is highlighted in the following screenshot.

textobject.phrase: Switch to design tab in the SWT Designer

section.para: Use SWT Designer to change the layout of the Composite of the part to a GridLayout .
Click in the Palette on Button and add a few buttons to your user interface.
Add a Label and a Text field.

section.title: Add a SelectionLister to your button
section.para:
Assign an SelectionLister (event handler) to one of your buttons for the widgetSelected . You can to this via a right-click on the button. Select
Add event handler selection widgetSelected
.

textobject.phrase: Assign an EventHandler to your Button

section.title: Review the generated code
section.para: Switch to the Source tab and review the code generated by the SWT Designer.
